security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with read-only file access. No code execution, network calls, or file writing capabilities. Only uses Read, Grep, Glob tools to search bundled OpenTelemetry documentation.

content.value_statement: Need correct OpenTelemetry attributes or collector configuration. This skill provides instant access to semantic conventions, OTLP protocol docs, and .NET instrumentation patterns.
actual_capabilities: Search semantic conventions for correct attribute names and types
Find collector processor, exporter, and receiver configurations
limitations: Only provides information from bundled documentation
Does not write or modify any code
Does not execute or test OpenTelemetry configurations

best_practices: Always check the INDEX.md to find the right documentation file
Mention the source document when providing answers
Warn users if SYNC-REPORT.md shows documentation warnings
anti_patterns: Do not provide deprecated semantic conventions
Do not use vendor-specific exporters in examples
Do not skip reading the full context before answering

faq.question: Which OpenTelemetry versions are supported?
faq.answer: Uses latest stable semantic conventions only. Does not include deprecated attributes.

faq.question: What programming languages are covered?
faq.answer: Primary focus on .NET 10 patterns. Documentation covers OTLP protocol and collector config.

faq.question: Can this skill write OpenTelemetry code?
faq.answer: No. This skill only reads and provides information from bundled documentation files.

faq.question: Does this skill send data externally?
faq.answer: No. All file access is read-only from the local plugin docs directory.

faq.question: What tools can this skill use?
faq.answer: Read, Grep, and Glob tools only. All read-only operations on documentation files.

faq.question: How is this different from general Claude knowledge?
faq.answer: Provides structured access to verified OpenTelemetry documentation with specific search strategies.
